column4: does anyone know if it's possible to connect a run action to data cd's ?
or cd's in general ?
well when you insert an ubuntu cd, the update manager opens, so my guess is yes
isn't this more like an autorun function, which also needs to have something on the cd ?
I'd simply like to be able to run qemu on cd's
you mean you want to be able to run executables off a mounted cd? - that's easy, you just need the right file permissions
no
I want to be able to use the cd as a device for qemu (qemu -cdrom /dev/hdc or something)
yep, that's no problem
as long as you're not trying to write to it...
well I generally don't write to cd's.. but I would I go about doing this ?
what I want is to be able to right click the cd and say run this
yes you can run executables from a cd - whether under linux or through qemu - I don't see any problem
I don't want to run anything -from- the cd, I want to run the cd (as a bootable device with some VM softwre)
I think I understand - you want to have a VM running, eg qemu, drop in say a live cd, & have the live cd boot? I think that should work
all you should need is the 'boot -d' option - to boot off the cd
boot -c /dev/cdrom
yes.. I can do it from the commandline.. no problem.. but I wonder if I can set it as a menu option, when I right click the CD
sure, create a menu entry to that effect, or just put a link on the desktop
link on the desktop would no apear in the 'right click cd menu' and I don't know how to add items to that menu
well it's doable - maybe google
any sugestion for search terms? because  I've got no idea where to look
you should have no problem doing this through Apps -> Accessories -> Alacarte Menu Editor -> File -> New Entry
thanks, except I don't have the 'file' in there ?
